comments.body: yes
No there still usefull
Nah I disagree villagers are useful and I will hate it if they go
I really prefer the current system.  Gives me a good reason to have a large village with many more to trade with.  Infinite trading means you only need a few of each at most.
No

More trades would be nice ðŸ˜º i don't want to have hundreds of villagers in order to get enough of a block in order to make a substantial build, especially cause the computer i use to play minecraft wouldn't be able to handle it...

I personally hate the fact that he doesn't move and gets in the way of everything! In all of my builds I usually have to build houses and stuff around him. He can also get stuck in the most weird and annoying places!
Llamas, Alpacas, long necked spitting sheep...whatever, you know what I mean.  Thanks for the correction though. :)
So true! You can kill the Trader (which I suggest you do after finishing your transactions), or they could make them not move at all.

Noticed some other odd behaviors with them this weekend.  

1. He walked in my nether portal leaving his llamas behind.  I couldn't find him after he went in.  I think he might have perished.  I secured his llamas and named them "Lost" and "Damned".  A day later they had disappeared.  

2. If he accidentally walks into a berry bush he goes nuts running around like crazy jumping all over the place pulling his llamas with him (Making him even MORE destrctive).  He kept running back into the berry bushes too which was quite comical.  Ultimately he ended up killing himself and his llamas.  #DeathByBerries

3. I walk out of my base and there were two wandering traders just staring at each other.  Like they were having a meeting trying to figure out a plan of attack.  "okay I'll ruin the watermelons, you take the pumkins, okay?"  Or perhapes the trader from 1. did not perish in the nether and returned to claim his llamas and then was simply surprised to see a doppleganger?  I don't know.
yeah and 4 emeralds for a slimeball slimeball 4 emeralds for this useless thing I would be killing him for that!!!!!!!!
He also shows up when I'm deep in a mineshaft or in my Skeleton grinder. ðŸ¤” You should ensure that he only spawns on the surface.

He always shows up in my underground base, even though there is technically no possible way for him to enter it. So even the idea that this guy just suddenly stopped over, really doesn't fit.  It's annoying, but he's a ready source of leather and leads, so there's that.  :/

I think the program should limit his spawning to the surface level.  That would at least make sense.  If the player is underground, don't spawn the traveler near the player. It's illogical.

FWIW: I've also had raid patrols spawn underground near my base, when working in a large underground area with grass blocks.

I agree. I am tired of having to replant my melons when the trader and his llamas have spawned close to my crops. I have not had crops destroyed by any other mobs. And, fences don't help when the trader spawns inside them.
My roommate and I just discussed this! In addition to flowers/seeds. We think it would be great to also possibly have dyes that come from flowers.
I would like a Florist Villager to be able to trade in flowers so players have an easier access to dyes and perhaps the florist could also trade dyes and flower pots and bonemeal.
The best thing is that you can sell flowers, because I don't know what to do with my many flowers.
I can make a mod for that if you'd like?

Such a cool idea!

I would like to see this in the game.

You get my vote! :)
I love this idea. What would make it better is if Purifiers were once normal villagers: aka a villager could become a Purifier when struck by lightning or something.
You mean weakness. You can't cure a villager without weakness potions, slowness might make it easier but isn't necessary.

Currently Baby Villagers plays tags with each other, they also jumps on beds and they can can follow a adult villager around (like other baby animals follow their parent)

But yes, I would like to see Baby Villagers do more stuff, perhaps help farmers planting crops from time to time, go fishing, share flowers with each other, ride pigs etc. make the game more immersive!
I like that idea! maybe the baby village from the artic biome can throw snow balls and taiga babys can sit next to the campfire singing some music.
I like that idea! maybe the baby villager from the artic biome can throw snow balls to each other and taiga babys can sit next to the campfire singing some music.
jowel
I would love it that this is in the Game because im making an custom village and i want them to play Hide and seek and the others and the Golem thing is so good too it will be cute!

Also changing  the hay block into targets in the pillager outpost target dummies would even help show this behavior. Pillagers woukd actually practice shooting a target abd make the game more interactive. They would only try to shoot it if it is within the same distance it takes a pillager to notice a player. Add sounds of hitting and missing the target would be funny too *hurray strike!* *sad misses*
Do you have any idea how happy I was to see this post? This post made all my dreams about archery mobs come true. I truly recommend everyone to follow and vote this post!
Perhaps rather than changing the scarecrow/target dummy, you could make pillagers shoot hay bales too?
I agree with this idea cuz I lost a whole village a zombie and an iron golem

Maybe we could utilize the dungeon underneath some villages (make some form of dungeon spawn under every village - not always a stronghold though). There could be guard villagers down there and iron golems/guard villagers could go down there and imprison any dangerous villagers. Maybe there could even be some form of healer down there that would attempt to heal zombie villagers, turning them back into villagers and then releasing them - or if the process fails, just killing them or turning them into another monster, that would stay imprisoned. Raids may also attempt to bust monsters out of the jail.
There should be stronger.

I agree but I think this idea could be better. Zombie villagers would run from golems and the golems would chase them into the jail. It would naturally generate in villages and you can make a jail by having an enclosed room with an Iron door and pressure plate.
great idea, both for maintaining village populace and for when you're starting a village from zombies
369511318972 Read this page  https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360005029872#npcs it's been stated that villagers don't want to be guards.

Not a personal fan of the idea. What if your base build includes wooden doors for the aesthetic design? That would kind of ruin it. Besides, how would the game even recognize a player built base? It's far easier for structures the game itself generated. And the idea that they can steal your stuff? Imagine you died during the raid and all of your backup gear was taken. What then? And as for the camp... that would have to be pre-generated I believe, so you'd have to find the closest one, wherever that may be. Dont get me wrong. I DO like the idea, being more opted towards the combat aspect of Minecraft, but I just dont think it will fit in the base game, or possibly even work well.
Only in hard mode tho
Would make it more challenging and force us to build walls and defense. Maybe only a certain gamemode?
Maybe instead of Bad Omen working how it does now, it triggers a raid when you're near a bed? (this won't break the village raids because the village houses have beds now) Just a suggestion.

I like the idea of this- and have a few things to add.

-There is a new kind of thieving pillager.

-There are also unbreakable chests in all pillager outposts. When the pillager despawns, the items will go into a chest at the nearest outpost until the chests are full. Then items stop being collected.

--The more full the pillager outpost chests are, the more pillagers spawn there

--In easy and normal mode, these chests can be raided by players normally.--In hard mode, these chests can only be opened using a key, which are a pillager drop

-It takes longer to take a block than to take from chests, but pillagers wielding axes should be able to switch to pickaxes to help. Only a certain number of pillagers can work a block at a time. The time it takes scales with block value

-Pillagers take more time going through fuller chests

--In easy mode, only one of the new pillagers can pick up items, and he has a limit to how much he can carry. He's not efficient at finding treasure. A damaged block is reset if all pillagers stop harvesting it. Old pillagers will attack if hit while collecting a block

--In normal mode, the new pillager's AI is better, and he holds more. 

--In hard mode normal pillagers act like easy mode thieves. A damaged block is reset when the player breaks the block and places it again. Any pillager carrying items will get a backpack, and drop those items upon death
Now that's what I call a challenge for combat skills and basics!
Not an fan of this idea because when building you don't want to use iron doors that often
Perhaps they could raid you if you have banners, which would stop them from spawning nearby with the exception of a raid.
i have traps in my house but i got to say no to this, and their should be a new Redstone block that identifies hostile mobs and sends a Redstone signal for better traps

I admire your ideas and hard work (yes, I've done post like this too where it is loong). I will vote for it, but I don't think all the  features in your post should be included. However, the ones I do like, I feel very strongly for them to be added. Please post more :)
Iâ€™ve always wanted the illusioner in the game!
Another good spawning point for them would be the igloos since they are already bundled up and would fit the environment!
hopefully it will be added
also could be a way to train them in specific jobs.

Instead of schools, it would be interesting if baby Villagers had Apprenticeships where they followed an adult Villager around and learned the trade. Their clothing could change to match this, making it easier to identify what they will be

Now that they are adding excavation sites, an archeologist villager would be perfect!

First because who else could have dug there? Of course, the person who dug could have left the site abandoned, but from what we can see now, archeology sites are recent structures, contrary to mineshafts for example, so they should be inhabited by at least one archeologist or paleontologist.

It seems obvious that they would pay you for the treasures you find. But also, I think they should be the ones who sell the brushes, because it adds more challenge than finding everything you need to dig in a chest like what we've seen during the Minecraft Live.

I think you put it in a brew it might give you DNA of the ancient creature the fossil is fossil with the DNA you can inject it into a mob and when you breed with a animal you put DNA in that ancient creature would come out
Also, there is a greater chance of a fossil spawning under a village with a paleontologist/ archaeologist

Hey ClayGoddessSari,

I've noticed that you are providing lots of good feedback on people's posts and so I thought I'd make a special effort to return the favor :)

This is a good idea; as a matter of fact, I've mentioned it in my Trading Reforms post because it just makes sense. Voted.
Maybe also a new special music disc that you can just get from these villagers?
Maybe they donâ€™t sell all types of music discs because there is a specific  reason creepers will drop them under right conditions.
great idea can we have this?
Ascyt yea it could be called "Village Town" maeby idk I just thought of that as at least an idea, but it should be calming.
Ya I Can't Wait To Be Able To Listen To Music In Minecraft Without Having To Kill Monsters

Workstation block - jukebox

Sell - note block, music disc, jukebox
if you can get music discs from them the song should be called "Villager town" with a similar beat to "Funky town"

This sounds like a cool idea, until you remember that music discs are supposed to be rare. I feel like having a villager that can trade you one takes away from the excitement that comes with finding each new music disc. Also, having the villager's workstation be a jukebox is also very unlikely. Since the jukebox costs a diamond to make, it might take away from the progression aspect of the game as well, if you can just get it as soon as you spawn in.
Tell me what do you think about this idea
And remember, Follow And Vote
This reminds me of another post with a cave themed villager. perhaps it could trade rarer items.

This would be so cool!
Like master wu from ninjago?
Similar, but not the same
How about they give you potions and enchantments instead of wands
Especially considering there are actual witches in the world.
They spawn from villagers struck by lightning. and remember that purple hooded Witch? well, they should look like that.

They should also protect villagers, live in villages, and use the cauldron and brewing stand. they should also heal golems, other friendly witches, the player, villagers, and zombie villagers.

A few other things is that Evokers can use "Woolooloo!" to turn the witches against you and they will stay that way until you kill the Evoker.

My idea for witches is that you can make them non-hostile by throwing emeralds at them. Once they've picked up a random number of emeralds â€“ maybe 3â€“10 â€“ you can trade with them. They would have a random selection of potion ingredients that they want to buy and sell. Maybe they revert to being hostile at night and can only be traded with during the daytime.
That is the coolest ideas I've heard. I hope Mojang added that and call it the "Magic Update"or the "Witch Update".
Omg so great!
this should be a thing
also let you just name the name tag to change the texture
Oh my God! Yes! That is genius!

I would bee (hahaha) scared of them too... they are far scarier than murder hornets (2020) and bees are capable of retaliating against wasps by vibrating so fast that they cook the wasp!!! I think everything should be (realistically) scared of those bees, especially baby villagers! they should also be scared of spiders.
if you give them a bottle they should catch bees with it.
Baby villagers are afraid of bees.

that would be awesome, and we are looking forward to see longship! (minecraft players are enough of little boat )
I would be great but when you kill the scout which it will spawn near a village it will drop compasses and pillagers outpost map

Raids are only meant to happen if you attack an illager captain as retribution, this illager would be devastating to villages. Instead it should follow players with the bad omen effect and carry a sword and binoculars, an item that works exactly like irl, it should run away if you chase after it

Thought I give my version. If there is a tamed pure black cat following, witches won't attack. Thinking of different trades like rotten potatoes, nether wart, ghast tear, basically the stuff to brew with for other stuff.

Afterwards, they could trade you potions, and they buy potion ingredients from the nether like Blaze powder and ghast tears.
I love this idea! I have been wanting witch trading for a while. I hope this gets added!

Maybe the zombies are buffed and have an extremely rare chance of dropping a new totem. The totem of flesh which gives you plus maximum health
But there are already witches.

I like this, Maybe the purple particles has a small nether portal block in the middle and the witches walk through it. also, witches spawning in the nether should immediately drink a night vision potion, and a fire resistance potion. they should be able to spawn in basalt deltas as well because of the mass amounts of magma cubes. finally, they should attack blazes with splash bottles of water.
Nina Chan The witches that already spawn in the Overworld would just spawn in the Warped Forest, and the Witch mob would have the behavioral changes
Did you know that one of the warped forest sound effects is actually a witch's cackle, in reverse, reverberating? Something about the place seems bewitched to me ...

This would be a great use for all the banners they drop. Spread them around your village as a sign that we donâ€™t take kindly to your folk.

Even the banner by itself I think would be a good way to ward them off.

Yes, I agree. Something involving the Ominous Banner (only ones obtained by killing Captains) and another ingredient.

Also, simply placing a Captain's Ominous Banner would have a smaller effect. A Captain's Ominous Banner and other ingredient would be the best option, with the largest area of effect.

NB: Having patrols spawn in your base is exceptionally annoying.

Craft an ominous banner with a banner of your own design to get a warding banner. (with that design) The warding banner would keep pillagers away and its area could be extended by more banners of the same design. Raids could be triggered around this area like a village.
Had the same idea, thank you for coming up with it sooner!

I came here to post this exact suggestion. I was making a 'free-range' village and I was working outside the village and a patrol spawn right in the middle of the village and killed my best trading villagers. My idea was the same. Put up an ominous banner and that prevents patrols from spawning in a certain radius, and prevents them from wandering near it.

Upvoted. Hope they add this.

I just want to add how cool it would be to give those banners an actual function in the game. And players can design intimidating totems or structures and place them strategically throughout areas of their world and they would have the real function of repelling illagers.
